text.title: Entertain a Child on a Rainy Day
text.head: Entertain a Child on a Rainy Day
text.p: A rainy day can make it difficult to keep a child entertained all day inside but it gives for the perfect opportunity to try new activities together . This article will provide you with a whole day of activities to keep your child engaged in fun . We ’ll cover how to build a pillow fort , make blueberry muffins , and activities to do with friends .
text.head: Ingredients
Making Blueberry Muffins
Steps
Building a Pillow Fort

list.item: Ask the child you are watching to help build a pillow fort with you . Go into a room with a couch . This will be the room your pillow fort will be built in . Measure the area and rearrange furniture to accommodate the potential size of your fort . Avoid building your fort near windows , doors , and exterior walls .
Arrange two chairs about 3 feet from the couch , facing each other to make the other two corners of your fort . These chairs will also serve as shelves in your fort .

Drape a bedsheet over the top of the chairs and the couch to provide a roof . Make sure the long edge is covering the top of the couch backrest for a maximized space . Lightly tug on the ends of the bed sheet to ensure it is covering all sides .

Secure the roof by holding down the ends of your blanket with clean , heavy items ( books , large toys , canned goods , etc. ) or string to stabilize your fort . Make sure you leave space for an entrance/exit and gaps between blankets for ventilation .
Adjust the distance between your chairs and the couch to be closer together to prevent the bed sheet from slipping .

Cover the floor of your fort with comfortable items to sit on . Do n’t use the comforter from your bed , instead try layering the floor with sleeping bags , thick blankets , and pillows you do n’t mind getting dirty .

Divide areas in your fort with couch cushions to section off smaller rooms within your fort and add glow sticks or a flashlight for lighting . Ask your child if they would like to bring their favorite toy or stuffed animal into the pillow fort as well .
Bean bags and air mattresses make for enjoyable seating . Make sure your roof is high enough before attempting to include them to your fort .

text.head: Making Blueberry Muffins

list.item: Wash your hands with soap and water . Be sure your child does too , then ask them to help prep the work space . Clean off all surfaces with a sponge and hot , soapy water . Preheat oven to 400 °F. Get out all ingredients and measure them .

Mix together flour , oatmeal , sugar , salt , and baking powder in a large bowl , then mix in blueberries .
Do n’t add more than the instructed amount of blueberries . They might look sparse in the batter , but there will be plenty of blueberry in the muffins because blueberries bleed while baking .

Break the egg into another bowl and use a fork to beat it . In the new bowl , add the milk and vegetable oil , then mix together . Add this mixture to the mixture from step 2 in the large bowl . Using a mixing spoon , gently stir all the ingredients together to avoid squishing the blueberries . Your mixture should have lumps so do n't mix more than 25 to 30 stirs .
Spray a muffin tray with nonstick spray and spoon in the muffin mix . Fill 12 muffin cups about two-thirds of the way up . Clean excess muffin mix from spills on the tray .

Put the tray in the oven after it ’s finished preheating and bake for about 20 minutes . When muffins are finished baking , remove from oven . Allow muffins to cool about 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely .

Clean up after you ’re done . After your snack is ready to go , put away all the unused ingredients in the fridge or cupboard . Wash the muffin tray , mixing bowls , and mixing utensils . Use a sponge with soap and hot water to wipe up crumbs and sticky spills on the counters .
Eat your blueberry muffins . All your hard work will taste delicious ! Leftovers should be stored inside a container and kept in a pantry .

text.head: Doing Activities with Friends

list.item:
Invite a friend of the child you are entertaining to come over . Ask the child which of their friends they would like to have over , then call the chosen friend on the phone to invite them over . Confirm the play date details with the friend ’s parent before having them over .
If you do n't have the friend ’s phone number beforehand , obtain it from the child ’s parent or a phonebook .

Play a game of Go Fish .
Sit together in a circle and shuffle a deck of cards . Deal 7 cards to each player , then set the remainder of the deck face down in the center of the circle . Each player should look at their cards , careful not to show any other players . Then it is the player to the left of the dealer ’s turn to ask any player for a card with a value ( numbers , jack , queen , king or ace ) , which they must have in their hand while asking .
If the person asked has the card , they must hand it over to askee . This makes a match and the askee can set down their two matching cards for points . The askee receives another turn until asking a player for a card they do not have .
When the person asked does not have the card , they say “ Go Fish ” . The askee ’s turn is over and they must pick a card from the center . The player to the left of them now has a turn .
Continue taking turns until all cards run out . The winner is the player with the most matches .
Example : “ Adam , do you have any sevens ? ” “ Go Fish ”

Watch a movie . Bring a laptop inside the fort you made in part 1 and let the children choose a DVD or a movie from a streaming site rated PG or lower . Make sure the children are comfortable and have enough blankets before playing the movie . Provide them with water and leftover snacks from part 2 . You can now relax , you have provided entertainment to last a child all day inside .
